F2F0BA40DFE401315AF768A86D17958E.description: Students will acquire the skills necessary for participating in a group, including defining an objective, dividing responsibilities, and working cooperatively.

F2F07CB0DFE401315AF668A86D17958E.description: Students will develop and employ the civic skills necessary for effective, participatory citizenship [Participation].

F2F03560DFE401315AF568A86D17958E.description: Students will understand that American citizens have distinct responsibilities (such as voting), rights (such as free speech and freedom of religion), and privileges (such as driving).

F2EFF260DFE401315AF468A86D17958E.description: Students will understand the responsibilities, rights, and privileges of United States citizens [Citizenship].

F2EFB650DFE401315AF368A86D17958E.description: Students will understand that respect for others, their opinions, and their property is a foundation of civil society in the United States.

F2EF77B0DFE401315AF268A86D17958E.description: Students will understand the principles and ideals underlying the American political system [Politics].

F2EF39A0DFE401315AF168A86D17958E.description: Students will understand that positions of authority, whether elected, appointed, or familial, carry responsibilities and should be respected.

F2EEDCA0DFE401315AF068A86D17958E.description: Students will understand that leaders are sometimes chosen by election, and that elected officials are expected to represent the interests of the people who elected them.

F2EE8F90DFE401315AEF68A86D17958E.description: Students will examine the structure and purposes of governments with specific emphasis on constitutional democracy [Government].
